trans-unit.source: To add a StorSimple backup policy
trans-unit.target: To add a StorSimple backup policy

trans-unit.source: On the device **Quick Start** page, click the **Backup Policies** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the device **Quick Start** page, click the **Backup Policies** tab.

trans-unit.source: This will take you to the **Backup Policies** page.
trans-unit.target: This will take you to the **Backup Policies** page.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click **Add** to start the Add Backup Policy wizard.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click **Add** to start the Add Backup Policy wizard.

trans-unit.source: Add a backup policy 1
trans-unit.target: Add a backup policy 1

trans-unit.source: In the **Add Backup Policy** dialog box, under **Define your backup policy**, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add Backup Policy** dialog box, under **Define your backup policy**, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Specify a backup policy name that contains between 3 and 150 characters.
trans-unit.target: Specify a backup policy name that contains between 3 and 150 characters.

trans-unit.source: Click the check box(es) to assign one or more volumes to this backup policy.
trans-unit.target: Click the check box(es) to assign one or more volumes to this backup policy.

trans-unit.source: Note that you cannot select volumes that use different cloud service providers.
trans-unit.target: Note that you cannot select volumes that use different cloud service providers.

trans-unit.source: If you are using multiple cloud service providers, based on your first selection, the list will show volumes belonging to only that cloud service provider.
trans-unit.target: If you are using multiple cloud service providers, based on your first selection, the list will show volumes belonging to only that cloud service provider.

trans-unit.source: This will allow you to group volumes belonging to a single cloud service provider in a snapshot.
trans-unit.target: This will allow you to group volumes belonging to a single cloud service provider in a snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow icon
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow icon

trans-unit.source: arrow icon
trans-unit.target: arrow icon

trans-unit.source: to go to the next page.
trans-unit.target: to go to the next page.

trans-unit.source: Add a backup policy 2
trans-unit.target: Add a backup policy 2

trans-unit.source: Under **Define a schedule**, do the following:
trans-unit.target: Under **Define a schedule**, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the **Type of Backup** box, select **Cloud Snapshot** or **Local Snapshot** from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: In the **Type of Backup** box, select **Cloud Snapshot** or **Local Snapshot** from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Indicate the frequency of backups (specify a number and then choose **Days** or **Weeks** from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Indicate the frequency of backups (specify a number and then choose **Days** or **Weeks** from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Enter a retention schedule.
trans-unit.target: Enter a retention schedule.

trans-unit.source: Enter a time and date for the backup policy to begin.
trans-unit.target: Enter a time and date for the backup policy to begin.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon

trans-unit.source: check icon
trans-unit.target: check icon

trans-unit.source: to save the policy.
trans-unit.target: to save the policy.

trans-unit.source: The newly added policy will be displayed in the tabular view on the **Backup Policies** page.
trans-unit.target: The newly added policy will be displayed in the tabular view on the **Backup Policies** page.
